oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rifled musket
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This 1861 .58 caliber Springfield rifled musket was most likely an 1862 Union issue. Etched on hammer plate is a U. S. eagle. A cross (possibly Christian) is etched on the sawed-off barrel. Ramrod and sling loops are intact. Engraved on the butt plate are; the letters, "U. S." The date 1862 also appears on the butt plate. Rifles such as this were issued to state militias.
